Exceptions.h

00001 #ifndef _PASSENGER_EXCEPTIONS_H_
00002 #define _PASSENGER_EXCEPTIONS_H_
00003 
00004 #include <exception>
00005 #include <string>
00006 #include <sstream>
00007 
00008 namespace Passenger {
00009 
00010 using namespace std;
00011 
00012 /**
00013  * Represents an error returned by a system call or a standard library call.
00014  *
00015  * Use the code() method to find out the value of <tt>errno</tt> at the time
00016  * the error occured.
00017  */
00018 class SystemException: public exception {
00019 private:
00020         string msg;
00021         int m_code;
00022 public:
00023         /**
00024          * Create a new SystemException.
00025          *
00026          * @param message A message describing the error.
00027          * @param errorCode The error code, i.e. the value of errno right after the error occured.
00028          * @note A system description of the error will be appended to the given message.
00029          *    For example, if <tt>errorCode</tt> is <tt>EBADF</tt>, and <tt>message</tt>
00030          *    is <em>"Something happened"</em>, then what() will return <em>"Something happened: Bad
00031          *    file descriptor (10)"</em> (if 10 is the number for EBADF).
00032          */
00033         SystemException(const string &message, int errorCode) {
00034                 stringstream str;
00035                 str << message << ": " << strerror(errorCode) << " (" << errorCode << ")";
00036                 msg = str.str();
00037                 m_code = errorCode;
00038         }
00039         
00040         virtual ~SystemException() throw() {}
00041         
00042         virtual const char *what() const throw() {
00043                 return msg.c_str();
00044         }
00045         
00046         /**
00047          * The value of <tt>errno</tt> at the time the error occured.
00048          */
00049         int code() const throw() {
00050                 return m_code;
00051         }
00052 };
00053 
00054 /**
00055  * Represents an out-of-memory error.
00056  */
00057 class MemoryException: public exception {
00058 private:
00059         string message;
00060 public:
00061         MemoryException(): message("Unable to allocate memory.") {}
00062         
00063         MemoryException(const string &msg): message(msg) {}
00064         
00065         virtual ~MemoryException() throw() {}
00066         
00067         virtual const char *what() const throw() {
00068                 return message.c_str();
00069         }
00070 };
00071 
00072 /**
00073  * Represents an error that occured during an I/O operation.
00074  */
00075 class IOException: public exception {
00076 private:
00077         string msg;
00078 public:
00079         IOException(const string &message): msg(message) {}
00080         virtual ~IOException() throw() {}
00081         virtual const char *what() const throw() { return msg.c_str(); }
00082 };
00083 
00084 } // namespace Passenger
00085 
00086 #endif /* _PASSENGER_EXCEPTIONS_H_ */
